address3: T. Rowe Price Capital Appreciation Fund
longBusinessSummary: The fund normally invests at least 50% of its total assets in stocks and the remaining assets are generally invested in corporate and government debt (including mortgage- and asset-backed securities) and bank loans (which represent an interest in amounts owed by a borrower to a syndicate of lenders) in keeping with the fund's objective. It may also invest up to 25% of its total assets in foreign securities.
